place.name: KNOWLE ST GILES
place.gazetteerText: KNOWLE-ST. GILES, a parish in Chard district, Somerset; on the Chard canal, 2 miles NE by N of Chard r. station. Post town, Chard. Acres, 540. Real property, with Chaffcombe, £2, 896. Rated property of K. alone, £733. Pop., 104. Houses, 22. The manor and most of the property belong to Earl Poulett. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Valne, £72. Patron, the Bishop of London. The church is plain and good, and has a bell turret. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)

unit.name: KNOWLE ST GILES WITH CRICKET MALHERBIE
